message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper is about improving Neural Machine Translation (NMT) by incorporating document-level contextual information. The paper proposes a hierarchical attention model to capture the context in a structured and dynamic manner. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) sub-category of Computer Science, which is cs.CL. 

The paper also uses machine learning techniques to improve NMT, which suggests that it could belong to the Artificial Intelligence (AI) sub-category, which is cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a new model architecture, which suggests that it could belong to the Machine Learning (ML) sub-category, which is cs.LG. 

The paper also uses neural networks, which suggests that it could belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (NE) sub-category, which is cs.NE. 

Finally, the paper could also belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CV) sub-category, as NMT is often used in image captioning and other computer vision tasks.
